WE'RE A great place to work and play

about us

What is now recognized among North America’s premier family destinations by the likes of Conde Nast Traveler and Fodor’s Travel began with a dedicated group of neighbors from Benzie County simply looking for a place to ski. It is that spirit which has sustained Crystal Mountain for over 60 years and will see it endure in the decades ahead. Above all, this is the story of a mountain built by community. Learn about our history and what's next for Crystal Mountain »

Access to Veteran Resources

Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

MI Tri-Share Program

Crystal Mountain employees may be eligible for the MI Tri-Share Program. This program shares the cost of childcare between the State of Michigan, Crystal Mountain/Traverse City Tourism, and the employee (the employee will only pay 1/3 of the total cost, if eligible). Income guidelines and more information about MI Tri-Share can be found online. Learn more »

​

Crystal Scholarship Foundation

The Crystal Scholarship Foundation (501c3) was created to provide scholarship opportunities for Crystal Mountain employees and their dependent children. Scholarships worth up to $5,000 toward a university, college or trade school certification program are awarded annually.

The Crystal Scholarship Foundation searches out candidates through an application and panel interview process who exemplify solid character; strong work ethic; community service and academic proficiency.

Youth Employment

Building a career pathway early can benefit you further down the road and the hospitality industry is a great place to start that journey! This expansive industry can provide future opportunities with a variety of companies and businesses. One can learn to hone their communication skills or the importance of multitasking in a quick paced environment. At Crystal Mountain, we welcome minors and college students to start building their skills, experiences and career.

Minor Employment: Select positions are available for kids over the age of 14 in the following departments - Golf, Outside Maintenance, Food and Beverage, Recreation and Rentals. These eligible jobs are part-time or seasonal to accommodate school schedules, plus state and federal regulations. If you aren't sure what job is the right fit for you, please reach out to us at humanresources@crystalmountain.com.

Internships: Our leadership team is highly motivated to mentor young talent. Our internship programs are 10-12 weeks, available May through August. As part of our internship program, we provide two additional services to support a well-rounded hospitality experience - the Crystal Career Chat Series and the Crystal Shadowing Days.

Crystal Career Chat Series: Our interns meet with the Executive Committee team members throughout the summer to discuss their experiences and business insights.

Crystal Shadowing Days: You will spend a day with a selected Senior Leadership or Management team member to understand the departments daily operations, and to learn additional leadership responsibilities across the resort.

Opportunities for the upcoming summer season are posted each September.
